intro: Trichosanthes scabrella, commonly known as the rough gourd, is a vine belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces large, yellowish-green flowers that give way to elongated, spiny fruits. Its fruit is typically harvested when mature, and it is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant's botanical features make it well adapted to tropical and subtropical environments.
